items.title: Injured spinner Lyon a doubt for rest of Ashes
items.summary: Spinner Nathan Lyon is a doubt for the remainder of the Ashes after suffering a hamstring injury in Australia's series-sealing win in Adelaide.

items.title: OnePlus 15T's specs tipped
items.summary: Back in October, tipster Digital Chat Station shared specs of a compact OnePlus smartphone, said to arrive in the first half of 2026. Now, DCS has shared the specs of the OnePlus 15T, which will feature a 6.3" 165Hz screen of 1.5K resolution with a 3D ultrasonic fingerprint scanner embedded. The Onâ€¦

items.title: The 10 moments that decided the Ashes
items.summary: Australia have regained the Ashes after winning the first three Tests against England down under once again - here are the 10 moments that decided the destination of the urn.

items.title: The moment that Australia retained the Ashes
items.summary: Marnus Labuschagne takes the catch from Josh Tongue as England are bowled out for 352, giving Australia an 82 run win and a 3-0 series lead to retain The Ashes on day five in Adelaide.

items.title: England beaten to lose another Ashes in Australia
items.summary: England's Bazball regime is in tatters as yet another Ashes series in Australia is lost at the earliest possible opportunity.

items.title: 'Test career over for now?' - Ashes player ratings
items.summary: Chief cricket reporter Stephan Shemilt marks the performances of the Australia and England teams after the third Test in Adelaide.

items.title: 'That's the wicket' - Labuschagne takes brilliant grab to dismiss Jacks
items.summary: Marnus Labuschagne takes another brilliant catch at slip as Will Jacks is dismissed for 47 to leave England on 337-8 on day five of the third Ashes Test in Adelaide.

items.title: 'It's frustrating' - Smith out for 60 after poor shot
items.summary: Australia make the breakthrough as Jamie Smith is caught for 60 to leave England on 285-7, needing 150 runs to win the third Test on day five in Adelaide.

items.title: Redmi Note 15 Pro 5G in for review
items.summary: Redmi's Note 15 series has arrived on the global stage, and as you'd expect, it's a bit confusing. You've got the Redmi Note 15, the Redmi Note 15 5G, the Redmi Note 15 Pro, the Redmi Note 15 Pro 5G (the star of this article), and the Redmi Note 15 Pro+ 5G. We have all five phones at the office andâ€¦

items.title: Williamson beats Simpson after four knockdowns in Leeds
items.summary: Troy Williamson upsets the odds to stop Callum Simpson in brilliant fashion and win the British, Commonwealth and European super-middleweight titles in Leeds.

items.title: Given shares Howe's frustrations on trio of decisions
items.summary: Match of the Day's Shay Given shares Newcastle manager Eddie Howe's frustrations after a trio of decisions went against the Magpies in their 2-2 draw with Chelsea.

items.title: Spurs 'lost control' in defeat to Liverpool - Hart
items.summary: MOTD Analysis: Ill-discipline cost Tottenham against Liverpool - Joe Hart

items.title: How Man City smothered West Ham with 'suffocating' press
items.summary: Match of the Day's Joe Hart looks at Manchester City's "suffocating" press as they looked back to their dominant best in a 3-0 win over West Ham.

items.title: Top and bottom at Christmas - what does it mean?
items.summary: As we approach the halfway point of the season, what do the ghosts of Christmas past tell us about the Premier League title race and relegation battle?

items.title: Calvert-Lewin scores twice as Leeds thrash Crystal Palace
items.summary: Dominic Calvert-Lewin extends his scoring streak to five Premier League games with a superb double as Leeds United secure a comfortable victory over Crystal Palace at Elland Road.

items.title: Williamson drops Simpson four times in stoppage win
items.summary: Troy Williamson upsets the odds to stop Callum Simpson in brilliant fashion and win the British, Commonwealth and European super-middleweight titles.

items.title: Isak injury in chaotic Liverpool win gives Slot more problems
items.summary: Liverpool stretch their unbeaten run to six games but Alexander Isak's injury while scoring overshadows win at Tottenham.

items.title: Gyokores penalty sends Arsenal top of the table in win against Everton
items.summary: Arsenal striker Viktor Gyokores' first-half penalty sends the Gunners to the top of the Premier League table in win over Everton.

items.title: Wyatt beats GB team-mate Weston to World Cup gold
items.summary: Great Britain's Marcus Wyatt beats team-mate Matt Weston to World Cup gold in the men's skeleton in Sigulda, Latvia, while Zoe Atkin claims halfpipe gold in Colorado.

items.title: Romero wouldn't have seen red if referee 'did his job' - Frank
items.summary: Cristian Romero would not have been sent off in Tottenham's loss to Liverpool if referee John Brooks "did his job" properly, says Spurs boss Thomas Frank.

items.title: Man Utd 'could make January signing' amid Neves link
items.summary: Manchester United head coach Ruben Amorim says it is possible the club could make a January transfer window signing.

items.title: Brighton & Sunderland's first ever PL match ends in 0-0 draw
items.summary: Brighton's disappointing December run continues as they played out a goalless draw against Sunderland in the Premier League.

items.title: Broja heads home late equaliser for Burnley at Bournemouth
items.summary: Armando Broja heads home a dramatic late equaliser as struggling Burnley end their seven-game losing streak by claiming a precious Premier League point at Bournemouth.

items.title: Haaland scores twice as Man City beat West Ham
items.summary: Erling Haaland scores twice to help Manchester City beat beleaguered West Ham United for a fifth straight Premier League victory which moved them top of the table.

items.title: Liverpool hold on to beat nine-man Spurs
items.summary: Substitute Alexander Isak scores for Liverpool before being forced off with injury as Arne Slot's side win a chaotic Premier League match at nine-man Tottenham.

items.title: Chelsea fight back to claim draw at Newcastle
items.summary: Nick Woltemade scores an early double, but Chelsea fight back to claim a 2-2 draw against Newcastle United at St James' Park.

items.title: Deals: Samsung Galaxy S25 series, Galaxy Z Fold7, Pixel 10 series discounted
items.summary: The holiday season continues and so do the deals. If you plan to buy a new phone for yourself or as a gift, there are some good deals on Amazon US to check out. Outside of Amazon US, the official Samsung US online store is also offering big discounts on the Galaxy S25 lineup as well as the Galaxy Zâ€¦

items.title: Dobey dumped out by Gilding as Bunting progresses
items.summary: World number eight Chris Dobey suffers a shock second round exit at the World Darts Championship with a 3-1 loss to Andrew Gilding.

items.title: Oppo Reno15 Pro Mini's specs and launch timeframe tipped
items.summary: Oppo's Reno15 series currently includes three smartphones - Reno15, Reno15 Pro, and Reno15c. items.title: Samsung introduces SOCAMM2 LPDDR5X memory module for AI data centers â€” new standard set to offer reduced power consumption and double the bandwidth versus DDR5 RDIMMs

items.summary: Customers who resold World Cup tickets on Fifaâ€™s official platform say they are still waiting for thousands of pounds in payments.

items.title: Here's why HBM is coming for your PC's RAM â€”  HBM consumes around three times the wafer capacity of DDR5 per gigabyte, as AI supercharges demand for chips and advanced packaging
items.summary: AIâ€™s appetite for high-bandwidth memory is reshaping the global DRAM and NAND market, diverting wafer capacity and advanced packaging away from consumer products and driving sharp price increases across markets.

items.title: China convicts 27 people for smuggling 166 tons of critical chipmaking element antimony â€” heavily-restricted mineral used for semiconductor manufacturing exported without licenses, court decides
items.summary: A Chinese court sentenced 27 individuals for illegally exporting antimony ingots without licenses, with authorities saying more than 166 metric tons were smuggled earlier this year.

items.summary: French authorities have arrested a Latvian national suspected of installing malware aboard an Italian passenger ferry while it was docked in southern France.
